trans-unit.source: How are applications represented in the directory?
trans-unit.target: How are applications represented in the directory?

trans-unit.source: Applications are represented in the Azure AD using 2 objects: an application object and a service principal object.
trans-unit.target: Applications are represented in the Azure AD using 2 objects: an application object and a service principal object.

trans-unit.source: There is one application object, registered in a "home"/"owner" or "publishing" directory and one or more service principal objects representing the application in every directory in which it acts.
trans-unit.target: There is one application object, registered in a "home"/"owner" or "publishing" directory and one or more service principal objects representing the application in every directory in which it acts.

trans-unit.source: The application object describes the app to Azure AD (the multi-tenant service) and may include any of the following: (*Note*: This is not an exhaustive list.)
trans-unit.target: The application object describes the app to Azure AD (the multi-tenant service) and may include any of the following: (*Note*: This is not an exhaustive list.)

trans-unit.source: Name, Logo & Publisher
trans-unit.target: Name, Logo & Publisher

trans-unit.source: Secrets (symmetric and/or asymmetric keys used to authenticate the app)
trans-unit.target: Secrets (symmetric and/or asymmetric keys used to authenticate the app)

trans-unit.source: API dependencies (oAuth)
trans-unit.target: API dependencies (oAuth)

trans-unit.source: APIs/resources/scopes published (oAuth)
trans-unit.target: APIs/resources/scopes published (oAuth)

trans-unit.source: App roles (RBAC)
trans-unit.target: App roles (RBAC)

trans-unit.target: SSO metadata and configuration (SSO)

trans-unit.target: User provisioning metadata and configuration

trans-unit.source: A couple of notes and exceptions
trans-unit.target: A couple of notes and exceptions

trans-unit.source: Not all service principals point back to application objects.
trans-unit.target: Not all service principals point back to application objects.

trans-unit.source: Huh?
trans-unit.target: Huh?

trans-unit.source: When Azure AD was originally built the services provided to applications were much more limited and the service principal was sufficient for establishing an app identity.
trans-unit.target: When Azure AD was originally built the services provided to applications were much more limited and the service principal was sufficient for establishing an app identity.

trans-unit.source: The original service principal was closer in shape to the Windows Server Active Directory service account.
trans-unit.target: The original service principal was closer in shape to the Windows Server Active Directory service account.

trans-unit.source: For this reason it's still possible to create service principals using the Azure AD PowerShell without first creating an application object.
trans-unit.target: For this reason it's still possible to create service principals using the Azure AD PowerShell without first creating an application object.

trans-unit.source: The Graph API requires an app object before creating a service principal.
trans-unit.target: The Graph API requires an app object before creating a service principal.

trans-unit.source: How are apps added to my Azure AD instance?
trans-unit.target: How are apps added to my Azure AD instance?

trans-unit.source: There are many ways an app can be added to Azure AD:
trans-unit.target: There are many ways an app can be added to Azure AD:

trans-unit.source: Add an app from the [Azure Active Directory App Gallery](http://azure.microsoft.com/updates/azure-active-directory-over-1000-apps/)
trans-unit.target: Add an app from the [Azure Active Directory App Gallery](http://azure.microsoft.com/updates/azure-active-directory-over-1000-apps/)

trans-unit.source: Sign up/into a 3rd Party App integrated with Azure Active Directory (For example: [Smartsheet](https://app.smartsheet.com/b/home) or [DocuSign](https://www.docusign.net/member/MemberLogin.aspx))
trans-unit.target: Sign up/into a 3rd Party App integrated with Azure Active Directory (For example: [Smartsheet](https://app.smartsheet.com/b/home) or [DocuSign](https://www.docusign.net/member/MemberLogin.aspx))

trans-unit.source: During sign up/in users are asked to give permission to the app to access their profile and other permissions.
trans-unit.target: During sign up/in users are asked to give permission to the app to access their profile and other permissions.

trans-unit.source: The first person to give consent causes a service principal representing the app to be added to the directory.
trans-unit.target: The first person to give consent causes a service principal representing the app to be added to the directory.

trans-unit.source: Sign up/into Microsoft online services like [Office 365](http://products.office.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign up/into Microsoft online services like [Office 365](http://products.office.com/)

trans-unit.source: When you subscribe to Office 365 or begin a trial one or more service principals are created in the directory representing the various services that are used to deliver all of the functionality associated with Office 365.
trans-unit.target: When you subscribe to Office 365 or begin a trial one or more service principals are created in the directory representing the various services that are used to deliver all of the functionality associated with Office 365.

trans-unit.source: Some Office 365 services like SharePoint create service principals on an on-going basis to allow secure communication between components including workflows.
trans-unit.target: Some Office 365 services like SharePoint create service principals on an on-going basis to allow secure communication between components including workflows.

trans-unit.target: Who has permission to add applications to my Azure AD instance?

trans-unit.source: Only global administrators can:
trans-unit.target: Only global administrators can:

trans-unit.source: Add apps from the Azure AD app gallery (pre-integrated 3rd Party Apps)

trans-unit.source: All users in your directory have rights to add applications that they are developing and discretion over which applications they share/give access to their organizational data.
trans-unit.target: All users in your directory have rights to add applications that they are developing and discretion over which applications they share/give access to their organizational data.

trans-unit.source: Remember user sign up/in to an app and granting permissions may result in a service principal being created.
trans-unit.target: Remember user sign up/in to an app and granting permissions may result in a service principal being created.

trans-unit.source: This might initially sound concerning, but keep the following in mind:
trans-unit.target: This might initially sound concerning, but keep the following in mind:

trans-unit.source: Apps have been able to leverage Windows Server Active Directory for user authentication for many years without requiring the application to be registered/recorded in the directory.
trans-unit.target: Apps have been able to leverage Windows Server Active Directory for user authentication for many years without requiring the application to be registered/recorded in the directory.

trans-unit.source: Now the organization will have improved visibility to exactly how many apps are using the directory and what for.
trans-unit.target: Now the organization will have improved visibility to exactly how many apps are using the directory and what for.

trans-unit.source: No need for admin driven app publishing/registration process.
trans-unit.target: No need for admin driven app publishing/registration process.

trans-unit.source: With Active Directory Federation Services it was likely that an admin had to add an app as a relying party on behalf of developers.
trans-unit.target: With Active Directory Federation Services it was likely that an admin had to add an app as a relying party on behalf of developers.

trans-unit.source: Now developers can self-service.
trans-unit.target: Now developers can self-service.

trans-unit.source: Users signing in/up to apps using their organization accounts for business purposes is a good thing.
trans-unit.target: Users signing in/up to apps using their organization accounts for business purposes is a good thing.

trans-unit.source: If they subsequently leave the organization they will lose access to their account in the application they were using.
trans-unit.target: If they subsequently leave the organization they will lose access to their account in the application they were using.

trans-unit.source: Having a record of what data was shared with which application is a good thing.
trans-unit.target: Having a record of what data was shared with which application is a good thing.

trans-unit.source: Data is more transportable than ever and having a clear record of who shared what data with which applications is useful.
trans-unit.target: Data is more transportable than ever and having a clear record of who shared what data with which applications is useful.

trans-unit.source: Apps who use Azure AD for oAuth decide exactly what permissions that users are able to grant to applications and which permissions require an admin to agree to.
trans-unit.target: Apps who use Azure AD for oAuth decide exactly what permissions that users are able to grant to applications and which permissions require an admin to agree to.

trans-unit.source: It should go without saying that only admins can consent to larger scopes and more significant permissions.
trans-unit.target: It should go without saying that only admins can consent to larger scopes and more significant permissions.

trans-unit.source: Users adding and allowing apps to access their data are audited events so you can view the Audit Reports within the Azure Managment portal to determine how an app was added to the directory.
trans-unit.target: Users adding and allowing apps to access their data are audited events so you can view the Audit Reports within the Azure Managment portal to determine how an app was added to the directory.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft itself has been operating using the default configuration for many months now.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft itself has been operating using the default configuration for many months now.

trans-unit.source: With all of that said it is possible to prevent users in your directory from adding applications and from exercising discretion over what information they share with applications by modifying Directory configuration in the Azure Management portal.
trans-unit.target: With all of that said it is possible to prevent users in your directory from adding applications and from exercising discretion over what information they share with applications by modifying Directory configuration in the Azure Management portal.
